title: As Russia Steps Up Attacks on Grain Ports, U.S. Warns of Possible Ruse
description: A White House official said Moscow might stage an attack on a commercial ship and blame Ukraine.

title: Your Friday Briefing: The First Wins in the Women’s World Cup
description: Also, tensions between Iraq and Sweden and a gathering of golden retrievers.

title: Ukraine Starts Using U.S.-Made Cluster Munitions, Officials Say
description: The weapons are being used in the southeast, the officials say.

title: Reports of a Lioness Near Berlin Prompt a Sprawling Search
description: People were encouraged to stay home after the police received calls and a video of a wild cat believed to be a lioness in a town along the German capital’s southwest boundary.

title: Biden’s ‘Justice40’ Program Won’t Fix Racial Gap in Air Quality, Study Finds
description: The White House aimed for a race-neutral environmental justice strategy, but a new analysis questions whether the program can actually achieve its goals.

title: Antigovernment Protests in Kenya Leave Several Dead and Streets in Chaos
description: Antigovernment protests over price hikes and new taxes have left at least 29 people dead in recent weeks, prompting the country’s news outlets to join together to issue a dire warning.

title: What Russia’s Grain Deal Actions Mean for Ukraine
description: Moscow withdrew from a deal that allowed Ukraine to export grain across the Black Sea despite a wartime blockade, and warned that ships sailing around Ukrainian ports would be seen as military targets.

title: Europe Embraces the Siesta to Deal With the Intense Heat Wave
description: The siesta, a sacred afternoon break in Spain, was once mocked as lazy. But now, countries like Germany, which were among the siesta haters, are taking another look.

title: For Europe’s Older Population, Heat Is the New Covid
description: Scorching temperatures have threatened the health of the elderly and pushed them inside, while governments are trying to take extraordinary steps to protect them.

title: Investor Charged With Kidnapping ‘Crypto King’
description: Aiden Pleterski is accused of spending investors’ money on luxury cars and vacations before filing for bankruptcy, according to court records. Then he was kidnapped by one of his investors, police say.

title: Landslide Kills at Least 10 in Western India
description: More than 100 more people were feared to be trapped under debris, as torrential monsoon rainfall continued to pummel the country.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Russia Attacks Cities on the Black Sea as It Tries to Seal Off Ukrainian Ports
description: Odesa was targeted for a third night, and there was an explosion in Mykolaiv, a day after Moscow warned that attempts to get past its naval blockade might be seen as an act of war.

title: Wagner Fighters Are Training Troops on the Border With Poland, Belarus Says
description: The Belarusian defense ministry said the country’s special operations units had been jointly training with Wagner for a week at a military range near the city of Brest.

title: Cerberus or Caronte? Why Europe Is Starting to Name Heat Waves
description: The World Meteorological Organization has warned against naming heat wave events and said it has no plans to do so, despite calls by some experts who say names could raise awareness about heat’s dangers.

title: North Korea Stays Silent on U.S. Soldier Who Fled Into the Country
description: It may take days or weeks for the country to acknowledge that it has Pvt. Travis T. King in custody, and past practices suggest its response will be determined by Mr. King’s motive.

title: Kissinger Meets Xi as China Courts ‘Old Friends’ to Manage U.S. Rivalry
description: Beijing is turning to American contacts outside the Biden administration, especially those it deems more likely to listen, to try to influence Washington’s thinking on China.

title: Viral Video of Sexual Assault in India Renews Attention on Manipur
description: The attack on two women in the state of Manipur led to the first public comments from Prime Minister Narendra Modi, however indirect, about the monthslong violence in the state.

title: British By-elections: What to Know
description: Three seats in Parliament recently occupied by Conservatives are up for grabs in an election that may show which way the political winds are blowing.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: China pushes back against U.S. climate pressure.

title: Ukrainian Children With Cancer Fight Their Own War Within a War
description: The war with Russia compounds the struggles of pediatric cancer patients and their families, but it has also prompted positive changes in treatment in Ukraine.

title: Archaeologists Find Maya City in an ‘Empty Zone’ of the Yucatán Map
description: In a biological preserve in Mexico’s Campeche State, a team of archaeologists has documented pyramids, palaces, a ball court and other remains of an ancient city they call Ocomtún.

title: Theme Park’s Selective History Appeals to a New Spanish Nationalism
description: Puy du Fou España has drawn visitors with spectacular shows about Spanish history. But part of its success lies in what goes unsaid.

title: Stranded in Tunisia, Migrants Wait for Death
description: Tunisia has pushed African migrants to scorching no-man’s lands along its borders with little food and water. Under a deal with the European Union, Tunisia agreed to tighten border controls in exchange for aid.

title: Tesla Wants to Double Size of Its German Factory
description: The electric automaker wants to produce a million cars a year at its plant near Berlin, a step that would make it Europe’s largest car factory.

title: Swedish Embassy in Baghdad Is Set on Fire
description: Episodes of Quran burning in Sweden have angered many in the Muslim world and drawn condemnation from the country’s authorities.
